definition: labor (as opposed to capital or management)/the workers
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter
surname Fang

sentences.english: Labor hinted it would like to resume the broken dialogue with the management.
sentences.chinese: 劳方暗示愿意与资方恢复已中断的对话。

sentences.english: An employee finds a copy of "The Great Gatsby" and begins to read it aloud.
sentences.chinese: 劳方发现的“了不起的盖茨比”复印件，并开始朗读。

sentences.english: Can you wave them to your neighbor With a minimum of labor?
sentences.chinese: 能您挥动他们对您的邻居以劳方极小值？

sentences.english: Families rely on women for labor in the home.
sentences.chinese: 家庭依靠劳方的妇女在家。

sentences.english: Labour hinted it would like to resume the broken dialogue with management.
sentences.chinese: 劳方暗示愿意同资方恢复已经中断的对话。

sentences.english: Kick back and enjoy the fruits of your labor and the company of your loved ones.
sentences.chinese: 踢和享用您的劳方和您家族的公司果子。

definition: the owners of a private enterprise/management/capital (as opposed to labor)
industrial relations/relations between labor and capital
to cut wages
labor and employer
to receive a raise in salary
salary/wage
to dismiss with severance pay/to pay sb off
army, civil service and education/all branches of state employment
arbitration
service contract
equal pay for equal work
to reach agreement
to slacken off in one's work/to go slow (as a form of strike)
to pass the buck/to shirk responsibility
party caucus
salary/wage
